conclusion: Understanding the relationship between the light source and the objects casting shadows.
Shadow A is cast by the hand-like object with the light source in front, casting the shadow to the back.
Shadow B is cast by the ring with the light source in front, casting the shadow to the back.
Shadow C is cast by the bulletin board with the light source in front, casting the shadow to the back.
Shadow D is cast by the postcard with the light source in front, casting the shadow to the back.
If the light source moves to the back left, shadows will shift to the front right.
The size of the shadows will become smaller as the objects are further from the new light source.
If the light source moves to the back right, shadows will shift to the front left.
The size of the shadows will become smaller as the objects are further from the new light source.

Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move to the front right and become smaller when the light source moves to the back left; they will move to the front left and become smaller when the light source moves to the back right.
